item.title: A Radiohead song from 1997 is on the Hot 100 charts, thanks to TikTok
item.description: "Let Down" broke into the Billboard Hot 100 nearly 30 years after its release, marking just the fourth Radiohead song to enter the charts.

item.title: Anthropic settles AI book-training lawsuit with authors
item.description: Called Bartz v. Anthropic, the case deals with Anthropic's use of books as training material for its large language models.

item.title: Why the US government is not the savior Intel needs
item.description: Intel doesn't need cash. Instead, the struggling semiconductor giant needs to figure out how to drum up interest for its foundry business.

item.title: Libby’s library app adds an AI discovery feature, and not everyone is thrilled
item.description: Libby launches "Inspire Me," a genAI feature that helps its users find books to borrow from local libraries.

item.title: Meta to spend tens of millions on pro-AI super PAC
item.description: Meta's new PAC signals an intent to influence statewide elections, including the next governor’s race in 2026.
